instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN_L: What is PCH_INTVRMEN_L? PCH_INTVRMEN_L is a signal that stands for Internal Voltage Regulator Enable. When pulled high, this signal enables the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must be pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
Hi Folks

I have 3 of these lousy macbook air 2017 models

1st 1 did have a light but no more

this was the readings before i lost charge light

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> should be 3.3v is 2.7v

<RESISTOR>R6125</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R6120</RESISTOR> BOTH MISSING

<RESISTOR>R6121</RESISTOR> + <RESISTOR>R6126</RESISTOR> BOTH MISSING OR REMOVED

<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> – 2.7V

<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL>-2.7V

<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN_L</SIGNAL>-2.7V

<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN_L</SIGNAL>-2.66V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>= 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>-3.37V

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL>= 0V

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>=0V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Be sure all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors are in place and have good traces.
What is exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?

Resolder <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> first; you may need to change it.
Reball SMC, if you note corrosion near it.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
Hi no voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> checking on the fuse

3.3v on pp3v42

i will check

I will also look as i have 3 of these with 3 issues

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
Hi 
Have removed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> was 2 pins short on there via solder bridge just wondering if to buy a replacement or refit it

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
Resolder it and post its voltages.
Also post diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR>.
If no short, check <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
thx i will check just have to order a replacement as all the legs fell off lol

any idea on the 2 other <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

They are both intermittent work sometimes

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issues
threads.message:
So you have short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
What is exact ohm resistance?
Remove F7140 and check which side the short remains.
